moves.1. e4: This game was played in the Derbyshire League with me as white. I was playing a much stronger player and blundered fairly early, but managed to come back through the use of a head on attack.
moves.8. O-O e6: What should I threaten him with?
moves.9. d3 Qc7 10. Ng5 f6 11. Ne4: I think that's a good place for a knight, so far 1 pawn down but decent development.
moves.15. Qf1 Qxh5 16. Bf4 Nc6 17. Bd6: Trying to hit a weak point.
moves.17... Qh6 18. Re1: When in doubt, strike down the middle.
moves.19... Kd8: Taking it is asking for trouble
moves.20. Qf6+: But I don't mind this way either
moves.20... Kc8 21. Qxh8+ Nd8 22. Be7: Threatening mate and ganging up on the knight.
moves.25... Bxe8 26. Qxe8+ Kc7 27. Qxa8 Qd2 28: Bring my Queen back into play. Now to trade Queens.
moves.31. Qxd4+ Ka6 32. Qe3: If I can trade Queens, I'm fine to lose a pawn.
moves.32... Qc7: Hence the running off. Never mind, I've got an idea.
moves.33. Qa3+ Kb5 34. Qb3+ Ka6: Trying to keep the Queen on.
moves.35. Qa4+ Kb6 36. Re6+: Forcing the King onto the C-rank
moves.36... Kc5 37. Qc2+: He resigned here, I wonder why...
